body: cool, @zongtanghu Messaging tracing is a very important feature. Could you make your proposal as the RIP(http://rocketmq.apache.org/community/)? It would be helpful for community guys involvement.
@vongosling OK，these days，I will make my proposal as the RIP,including my detailed design.
I think it's just a simple comment mistake.
Hi  @vongosling @duhengforever @dongeforever ,I have already made my RIP and send it to those mail list(such as dev,user and commits).

Minimum free disk is determined by a system property "rocketmq.broker.diskSpaceWarningLevelRatio". If the disk partition space used percent exceed the ratio(default is 90%), broker will stop receiving new message.

@zongtanghu Got it. It seems to be good for PMC. Could you call for a vote after the 72 hours?

the process for the rip, please refer to http://rocketmq.apache.org/community/
看到了 4.3.2已经不存在这个问题了
OK，I know about the process for RIP.Thank you very much. @vongosling @dongeforever @duhengforever
@xiangwangcheng could you add your test code in your pr? just like your issue https://github.com/apache/rocketmq/issues/515

The first problem "clusterRT/checkMsgSendRT when amount is 1 return NaN" is indeed a bug, when amount is 1. I suggest you can propose a PR to fix it.
But i can't understand your second question, can you provide more details?

I think maybe the default  max message in the initial release version is 512KB, and then modified to 4MB, but forgot to change the annotation. Just a comment mistake, you can propose a PR to revise it if you are interested in.
@Cicizz Thanks for your PR，Transaction does not support delayed messages for the time being.

> @eicky 这里不是发广告的地方。你的一言一行，是面向全球开发者的。

在哪里删除？我想删除

@ymwneu  e.g ./mqadmin updateBrokerConfig -k messageDelayLevel -v 1s 5s 10s ... or -v "1s 5s 10s ..." the result is "1s" not the whole value, because of the blank between levels, do you have any suggestion
ps. I think -n ip:port only support one namesrv addr, ";" in Linux Command Line is the end of command, the description should update
ps. I read the code, the reason to drop the first request is reasonable, not to calculate connection time, but I will try a better way.

I tried command ./mqadmin updateBrokerConfig -k messageDelayLevel -v "1s 2s", found it can work normally.

[PR #533 ](https://github.com/apache/rocketmq/pull/533)
but If I open vpn, the two instance consumers have different customerid, how does rocketmq consider consumer have same consumerid? only by ip or other condition?

If you could be careful of the code of the RocketMQ parts - how to create a instanceId, you will find the answer. As for consumerId, you could set the same consumerid to assemeble a cluster to consume together;

I checked the code, found
`if (sendOK) {`
`            //xxxxxx`
`           doResponse(ctx, request, response);`
 `           //xxxxxx`
`            return null;`
` } `
method doResponse had already processed the response. 
In addition, feature SendMessageHook seems to be deprecated, i found no where use this hook in broker.
I have  seen your PR, i think it will cause a response send twice.

My mistake, i am not sure SendMessageHook will be deprecated.
I think in method executeSendMessageHookAfter, if response equals null, it means the message has been sent successful, so there is no need to set error message.

I suggest you provide more details, and ask this question by using mailing list.
http://rocketmq.apache.org/about/contact/
@liuliuwd Make sure there is enough memory, and make more data on page cache. BTW, enable the storeTransientPool could be a help.

> @jiangxinlingdu The code is better in the lock. But currently, the following code:
> `if (null == mappedFile || mappedFile.isFull()) { mappedFile = this.mappedFileQueue.getLastMappedFile(0); // Mark: NewFile may be cause noise }`
> will prevent creating duplicated mapped file. So it has no defects finally.

ok

In fact, it's not a bug. 
The method "getLastMappedFile(final long startOffset)" will invoke "getLastMappedFile()" again before create a new mappedFile.

> In fact, it's not a bug.
> The method "getLastMappedFile(final long startOffset)" will invoke "getLastMappedFile()" again before create a new mappedFile.

ok
Under normal circumstances, the broker will create two mappedFiles in advance. For more information, you can see "AllocateMappedFileService#putRequestAndReturnMappedFile".

> If the switch "transientStorePoolEnable" is on && the flushType equals "ASYNC_FLUSH" && broker is master && transientStorePool buffer is enough, broker will create two mappedFiles. For more information, you can see "AllocateMappedFileService#putRequestAndReturnMappedFile".

i see
@dongeforever If enable the storeTransientPool, message can't be got util commited?

RocketMQ提供了自动从Slave读取老数据的功能;

>> 主要由``slaveReadEnable``这个参数控制。默认是关的``(slaveReadEnable = false bydefault）``。推荐把它打开，主从都要开。这个参数打开之后，在客户端消费数据时，会判断，当前读取消息的物理偏移量跟最新的位置的差值，是不是超过了内存容量的一个百分比``（accessMessageInMemoryMaxRatio= 40 by default）``。如果超过了，就会告诉客户端去备机上消费数据。如果采用异步主从，也就是brokerRole等于ASYNC_AMSTER的时候，你的备机IO打爆，其实影响不太大。但是如果你采用同步主从，那还是有影响。所以这个时候，最好挂两个备机。因为RocketMQ的主从同步复制，只要一个备机响应了确认写入就可以了，一台IO打爆，问题不大。
由于broker资源固定，对broker来说，增加consumer消费理论上会对生产者TPS产生一定影响，但是根据实际的测试结果，这个影响应该是不大的。 你的producer和consumer是否在同一台机器上？如果在同一台机器上，并且consumer有一定消费逻辑，这可能占用机器资源，影响producer发送。

@Liberxue 官方的benchmark测试也有消费者影响生产者TPS的情况。

> @Liberxue 官方的benchmark测试也有消费者影响生产者TPS的情况。

肯定会影响的；

> 首先你是在同一个Topic做生产消费，我目前的解决方案是Master+Slave来做负载；其次 你在不同Topic生产消费TPS都会按Topic平均

当Master和Slave都正常的情况下，默认从Master处读取消息，若开启了[slaveReadEnable](https://github.com/apache/rocketmq/blob/master/common/src/main/java/org/apache/rocketmq/common/BrokerConfig.java#L111) ，且Master处积压了超过40%内存总量的未消费消息，那么会从Slave=1的Broker处读取消息。

- 当Master宕机时，长时间未向Namesrv发送心跳，Namesrv清空下线的BrokerData，Consumer从Namesrv获取的TopicRouteData里已经没有了Master的BrokerData，因此Consumer从自身的brokerAddr集合里找不到Master的BrokerAddr了，因此就按顺序向第一位Slave发送消息拉取请求。

- 默认配置下slaveReadEnable = false，因此Slave在从CommitLog读取到消息后，设置其suggest brokerId = 0 ,也就是建议其下次从Master处读取消息。

- 在Master为恢复前，都是读取不到其brokerAddr的，因此每次都是从Slave处拉取消息，虽然其每次都建议Consumer从Master处读取。当Master恢复了，从新向Namesrv发送了心跳，注册了Broker信息。Consumer获取的最新TopicRouteData里包含了Master的brokerAddr，那么下次就会听从建议从Master处读取消息，从Slave切换回Master。

建议你查看一下源码：

https://github.com/apache/rocketmq/blob/2b692c912d18c0f9889fd73358581bcccf37bbbe/broker/src/main/java/org/apache/rocketmq/broker/processor/PullMessageProcessor.java

https://github.com/apache/rocketmq/blob/a220364b752669c474f9795884faed9bb4e0a8c1/broker/src/main/java/org/apache/rocketmq/broker/BrokerController.java

最后 我也希望能不影响 哈哈 不过....

> * 当Master宕机时，长时间未向Namesrv发送心跳，Namesrv清空下线的BrokerData，Consumer从Namesrv获取的TopicRouteData里已经没有了Master的BrokerData，因此Consumer从自身的brokerAddr集合里找不到Master的BrokerAddr了，因此就按顺序向第一位Slave发送消息拉取请求。

确实读写分离在一定程度上能缓解master的压力；但在单master无slave的时候，这种情况是不是就不能避免了呢，或者说这种情况是正常的现象。

@AnyOSR 局部顺序是不需要保证单messageQueue的，只需要保证发送到一个messageQueue里面就行了吧，你说的是全局顺序的情况吧
@davidpdw 使用顺序消息到时候，建议在起始的时候记录一下分区数，防止中间某个服务宕机导致hash值发生变化导致消息乱序。另外，issue 一般用于bug report或者是feature quest，如果有这种咨询问题，建议订阅邮件列表（https://rocketmq.apache.org/about/contact/ ）里面搜索提问，会有很多小伙伴帮助你的。
@davidpdw 建议关闭自动创建topic的原因还有一个原因在于topic属于资源，topic的新增会带来很多的资源上的使用。另外，issue 一般用于bug report或者是feature quest，如果有这种咨询问题，建议订阅邮件列表（https://rocketmq.apache.org/about/contact/ ）里面搜索提问，会有很多小伙伴帮助你的。
